---

::: aside

Lightly adapted from: [NYT Cooking, Melissa Clark](https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1020191-creamy-white-bean-and-seaweed-stew-with-parmesan)

:::

- 1 lb dried white beans, soaked for 8 hours in 1L water, 
with 1 Tbsp salt and 1/4 tsp baking soda
- 1 large onion
- olive oil
- 1 fennel bulb, fronds reserved and chopped finely if available
- 3-4 celery stalks
- 3 carrots
- 4 cloves garlic
- 16 in^2 kombu, rinsed
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1/2 cup shredded dried wakame (like [this one](https://www.amazon.com/Chung-Jung-One-Premium-Seaweed/dp/B0075ZD08C/ref=sr_1_7?crid=2VORHVH0HDZ5L&dib=eyJ2IjoiMSJ9.zLwUnW_NCtwuSyVtC-ONUCZ0tem6KkefiEb5EG0Hv_QMrH_cGpASrUDhZsMPTGJ7KPISga-_BpNzbkQEGZEpBLSNkWOJdouOS5Iuw0U-hd6ziH4YS676fl2Jh-FTaQcD-zD5khLBxa2nJAsDf3rBlVbamPywxJqT68CjaWd1UnzyW_uGVQMPr5H_VCNdMCih9PX7GNlpN5sDKV9Hcy11IqLlNS21kuPT1JlqX1lsggWyvROncesYEluEvxokAxM-_-AyaNawwFqupEtyv-PKj_vcs7vMxJU-HOUB9MVUfK7vom9ePVAi6RGK2RndgYTQxZ_0Jz4VtDWaT51j2suigjPT2O8TMBtCbVgNOa4Zefct3SpJxFSnGH_LvN29TN714gHnzZOX7joXNaxIC99aUyegLMFz7KHZeb8xqHS0LSQwk0KHBoHLipHRSX8khbd6.CRJustO5UBg2I7XDgjKzF4Ny8uzJ4TZoGQcp_jBmbWk&dib_tag=se&keywords=soup%2Bseaweed&qid=1735491148&sprefix=soup%2Bseaweed%2Caps%2C152&sr=8-7&th=1))
- parmesean cheese

---

1. Set InstantPot to Saute. Dice onion. Add oil to pot with onion. Saute about 
5 minutes with a pinch of salt.
1. Meanwhile, dice fennel, celery, and carrots. Add to pot.
1. Finely chop garlic. Add to pot and saute another minute. Turn off pot.
1. Drain and rinse beans. Add to pot with 2-3 L water (or stock), the kombu, 
and the thyme. Season lightly with salt. 
1. Seal cooker and cook on high pressure for 20 minutes. Allow 
pressure to release naturally.
1. Open pressure cooker. Use an immersion blender for 2-3 seconds to blend a
small amount of the soup (most of the beans should remain whole).
1. Taste for seasoning and adjust with additional salt and pepper.
1. Add in the wakame and allow to rehydrate.
1. Serve in bowls with grated parmesean and any chopped fennel fronds
